locutie.beschrijving: The preacher contrasts the physical decline of King David and the existential dread of John Updike with the biblical promises of an eternal kingdom. The content moves from human impotence to the divine initiative of the Annunciation.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong. Connects the Davidic covenant's apparent failure with its Christological fulfillment, emphasizing the 'initiative of God'.

illocutie.beschrijving: The force shifts from descriptive (Assertive) to a proclamation of God's intervention (Commissive/Declarative) and finally to an invitation to joy.
voorbeelden: He has reached down into my deepest and most uncomfortable self — and yours.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: Comfort, existential security, and a shift from dread to hope.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The sermon relies on the 'Word made flesh' but does not explicitly name the Spirit's role in the hearing.

voorbeelden: John Updike is neither ignorant nor dying.
History appears to be going round and round.
I guess it would have to be David.
I simply cannot describe to you the horror.
The Lord himself will build a house for you.
His kingdom will have no end.
His arm is faithful, now and forever.
commissieven.kwaliteit: High. The sermon centers on the 'Toezegging' (Promise) of God's initiative.

declaratieven.autoriteit: Strongly grounded in the 'bisecting' nature of the Word.

indicatoren: Extensive biographical detail on David and Updike.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Intellectual engagement and empathy, but risks delaying the 'event' of the Word.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is addressed as a recipient of a promise, though late in the sermon.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Excellent; it moves from the historical David to the 'you' of the listener.
voorbeelden: He has reached down into my deepest and most uncomfortable self — and yours.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and identification with human frailty.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the listener's existential dread.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to apply the promise of Christ's presence.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Moves from the 'ignorant and dying' state (Assertive) to the 'God has moved' (Declarative) to the 'He is beside you' (Commissive).
voorbeelden: God has moved... He has reached down into... yours... Rejoice!
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: High; the indicative of grace founds the imperative of joy.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Emmanuel shall come to thee... Rejoice!

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon successfully transitions from 'talking about' human misery to 'performing' the promise of God's presence.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: the one who is beside us is the promised Son of David
sterke_punten.effect: Creates an encounter in the '3 AM' of the soul.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long list of geopolitical conflicts.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Information overload that delays the gospel event.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event when it claims Christ's presence for the listener's specific dread.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'bisecting' metaphor functions as a verbal icon of the Incarnation.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, emphasized through the concept of 'Annunciation'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, the preacher acts as the 'messenger' of the 'messenger'.
tekstueel_bewijs: the message was said to be, not from man, but from God

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly left to the 'power in heaven and earth'.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the Word 'bisects' the reality of the hearer.
tekstueel_bewijs: The vicious circle of our existence has been bisected

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavy on past-tense assertives initially but finishes with strong present-tense commissives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The promise made to David is fulfilled in Christ.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In this moment, Christ fulfills God's promise to you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a theological fact to a present event.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Maintain the '3 AM' address as it is the sermon's performative peak.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'we' and 'I' in the middle section.
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'you' more frequently when describing the 'rickety arrangements'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in moving from existential 'locution' to sacramental 'illocution'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' about her dream, SAT focuses on the 'Declarative' power of the dream's resolution in Christ.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: It does not just persuade the hearer that God is good; it 'promises' God's presence as a new reality.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's power is not in the Updike anecdote, but in the 'Commissives' at the end.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God has moved, not we to him in our impotence, but he to us.

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Moralistic Directive' trap by grounding all joy in the 'Divine Initiative'.
